subject: Re: Custom MethodSorter
msgSnippet: I m aware that JUnit discourages such dependencies. They work well for us, however, and we re going to keep having them (Either through method naming, or
messageBody:
I'm aware that JUnit discourages such dependencies. They work well for
us, however, and we're going to keep having them (Either through method
naming, or through a custom MethodSorter which would use a custom
annotation).
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kevin Cooney <kcooney@...> wrote:
>
> Question: why do you want your own method sorter? As Matthew mentioned
in
> his StackOverflow response, it's best to make test methods not
dependent on
> each other
>
> On Wed, Dec 5, 2012 at 4:27 AM, Eirik Lygre eirik.lygre@... wrote:
>
> > I'm looking at creating my own MethodSorter. Is there documentation
on how
> > to do that, and is it even possible?




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
